page.title: 15W.I. and Over 60s
page.content:
The Women's Institute was formed in 1919 and continues to meet once a month. The average attendance is 35 from a membership of 50. Speakers and demonstrations cover a wide range of subjects. A voluntary car service is provided by members for those in the Community who need the Doctor, Dentist or Hospital. The W.I. helps with the catering whenever large functions are held within the Community.
The Over 60s was formed 17 yrs ago and meets once a month in the village hall, or when weather permits, in friends' gardens. As well as having tea and a friendly get_together, members enjoy informative and entertaining talks. Coach trips extra to the meetings are made during the summer months. Transport to the meetings is provided by volunteers.
